results.title: Care of St. Christopher's
results.brief_description: A typical day at St. Christopher’s Home for the Children of Railwaymen, at Derby. This establishment cares for children whose parents work in transport but are unable for some reason to provide a proper home for them. How the staff of the Home look after the well-being of the children and provide the family atmosphere and individual interest which are so badly needed by the homeless child.

results.title: Care of art materials
results.brief_description: This film will be useful in primary classes in art education, but it will also be useful to any one using art materials. Its primary purpose is to promote greater care and interest in the use of the art tools commonly found in the school class-room in grades 1 to 4.

results.title: The Cardioid
results.brief_description: Illustrates the properties of the cardioid which are connected with the generation as a one-cusped epicycloid. In five parts, it deals with he double generation of the cardioid, the tangents, the normals, the evolute, and a recapitulation of these aspects. Curves mechanically drawn by Jack Peskett.

results.title: Carcinoma of the stomach: gastrectomy
results.creator_credit: Waltman Walters, William H ReMine and Mayo Clinic Film Library
results.brief_description: Shows radical subtotal and radical total gastrectomy with removal of omentum, lymph nodes and spleen. A preliminary discussion of advances in treatment of carcinoma of the stomach is given by the authors.

results.title: Carcase constructions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Basic woodwork”.
Using a knife box as an example, this film describes how boards can be joined at the corners. No other credits available.

results.title: Carburetor: principles of operation
results.brief_description: This film explains the major components of the carburetor - bore, bowl and air throttle. Also explains air pressure differential, metering, atomization and vaporization. Shows designs and devices used in carburetors.

results.title: Carbon fourteen
results.creator_credit: Warren P. Everote and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description: Explains the use of radioactive carbon as a means of determining the age of historic and prehistoric objects; shows how carbon fourteen is being used in studying the process of photosynthesis; and describes experiments at the Argonne National Laboratory, near Chicago, which are being conducted to study the effect of atomic radiation on plant growth.

results.title: Caravaners
results.creator_credit: George Johnson, John Taylor and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: The three-hundred Airstream caravans that are prowling the highways of British Columbia represent a new breed of nomad. Too active just to sit at home but too cautious to strike out on their own, these retired couples have signed up for an organized caravan tour sponsored by the company that manufactures the trailers. Few surprises are in store for the group, but then they’re never alone and they don’t have to worry about the day’s route or entertainment.
results.creator_credit_for_label: George Johnson, John Taylor and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: The Car behind
results.creator_credit: Commonwealth Department of Transport, Film Australia and Telemark Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “The Skills of Defensive Driving”.
Advises on the precautions to be taken when driving in front of another vehicle, including procedures for overtaking, increasing the distance between cars, and the use of brake lights, traffic indicators, and hand signals. Suitable for upper secondary level.
